item.description:
I'm working my way up to a 5k run at the end of June.  I'm not a runner, and I know nothing about running.  My goal is to be under 24 minutes for the 5k.

 

If you'd like to join me and work up to a 5K (3 mile run) this summer, join me at Gaudet School as we take advantage of their wonderful track.  Even when people are using the center field, we're allowed to run.  I'd highly suggest you bring your own drinking water and a pair of sunglasses.

 

Don't worry if you're slower or faster than I am - please come!  The more you run, the better you'll get.

 

Here are Adam's running times for every run he's done in 2011:

Monday (5/23) - 2 miles in less than 18 minutes (followed by 1 mile of untimed running)

Friday (5/27) - 2.5 miles in less than 22 minutes(followed by 1 mile of untimed running)

Monday (5/30) - 2.5 miles in less than 22 minutes

Friday (6/3) - 2.75 miles in less than 26 minutes

Monday (6/6) - 2.75 miles untimed

Friday (6/10) - 2.75 miles untimed

Here are Adam's lessons learned:

Minimize vertical distance moved

It's easier to run with other people

 

IMPORTANT: The address used by meetup isn't quite right.  It will take you to the front of the school.  The track is at the BACK of the school (it's off Whyatt Road).  Here's a map.  The track is the blue thing: http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=gaudet+middleschool&aq=&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=45.467317,45.263672&ie=UTF8&hq=gaudet+middleschool&...

 

Adam
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the guy with really short hair (or maybe an orange hat) standing near the track entrance (behind the tennis court)
item.name: Slowly Working up to a 5K Run
